title: Climate Change Worsened Deadly Africa Floods: Study
content: Human-caused climate change worsened floods that have killed hundreds of people and displaced millions in Cameroon, Chad, Niger, Nigeria and Sudan this year, according to a study published on Wednesday.
summary: Human-caused climate change worsened floods that have killed hundreds of people and displaced millions in Cameroon, Chad, Niger, Nigeria and Sudan this year, according to a study published on Wednesday.

title: Britain's King Charles To Be Offered High Chief Title In Samoa
content: Britain's King Charles will be offered the title of high chief in Samoa in a three-day visit starting Wednesday and will be shown the impact of rising sea levels due to climate change in the Pacific island nation.
summary: Britain's King Charles will be offered the title of high chief in Samoa in a three-day visit starting Wednesday and will be shown the impact of rising sea levels due to climate change in the Pacific island nation.

title: Adult Film Stars Launch 'Hands Off My Porn' Campaign Against Donald Trump
content: The '#HandsOffMyPorn' campaign is warning viewers that prominent allies of Donald Trump want to ban pornography and lock up the stars who bring it to vivid, graphic life.
summary: The '#HandsOffMyPorn' campaign is warning viewers that prominent allies of Donald Trump want to ban pornography and lock up the stars who bring it to vivid, graphic life.

title: Japan Makes Tepid Push On Gender Gap In Politics As Election Nears
content: Karen Makishima is the only female running for Japan's ruling party in her 20-seat prefecture for the October 27 general election, reflecting the tough battle women face in breaking into the country's male dominated politics.
summary: Karen Makishima is the only female running for Japan's ruling party in her 20-seat prefecture for the October 27 general election, reflecting the tough battle women face in breaking into the country's male dominated politics.

title: "Defenders Need Us": Ukraine Cafe Gives Glimpse Of Normalcy Amid Raging War
content: Russian troops are barely 10 kilometres from the city but in the cafe, the sounds of war are drowned out by the whir of the coffee machine.
summary: Russian troops are barely 10 kilometres from the city but in the cafe, the sounds of war are drowned out by the whir of the coffee machine.

title: Bill Gates Backs Harris With $50 Million Donation, "Concerned" Over Trump
content: Billionaire and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has recently donated about $50 million to a nonprofit organization supporting Kamala Harris' US presidential run, the New York Times reported Tuesday.
summary: Billionaire and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has recently donated about $50 million to a nonprofit organization supporting Kamala Harris' US presidential run, the New York Times reported Tuesday.

title: Chinese Warships Sailing Toward Sensitive Strait Amid Tensions: Taiwan
content: Taipei said Wednesday it had detected a Chinese aircraft carrier group sailing towards waters separating Taiwan and China, a day after Beijing held a live-fire exercise near the self-ruled island.
summary: Taipei said Wednesday it had detected a Chinese aircraft carrier group sailing towards waters separating Taiwan and China, a day after Beijing held a live-fire exercise near the self-ruled island.

title: Israel Confirms Killing Successor Of Hezbollah Chief Hassan Nasrallah
content: Israel's army confirmed Tuesday it "eliminated" Hezbollah's Hashem Safieddine, apparent successor of slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, in a strike in a southern Beirut suburb three weeks ago.
summary: Israel's army confirmed Tuesday it "eliminated" Hezbollah's Hashem Safieddine, apparent successor of slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, in a strike in a southern Beirut suburb three weeks ago.

title: McDonald's Linked To One Death, Dozens Of Food Poisonings In US
content: One person has died and dozens have fallen sick following a severe E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said Tuesday.
summary: One person has died and dozens have fallen sick following a severe E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said Tuesday.

title: "Huge Opportunity For...": Former NITI Aayog CEO On 'The India Century'
content: India's G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant today spoke at the NDTV World Summit in Delhi where he mentioned that this will be "India's century".
summary: India's G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant today spoke at the NDTV World Summit in Delhi where he mentioned that this will be "India's century".

title: Trump Threat To Democracy, Should Be Locked Up "Politically", Says Biden
content: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday Republican Donald Trump is a threat to Democracy and should be locked up "politically," as he exhorted Democrats at a New Hampshire campaign office to win the Nov. 5 election.
summary: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday Republican Donald Trump is a threat to Democracy and should be locked up "politically," as he exhorted Democrats at a New Hampshire campaign office to win the Nov. 5 election.

title: West Asia Crisis Impacts India's Goal To Be $35 Trillion Economy: Ex-Envoy
content: India's goal of becoming a $35 trillion economy by 2047 hinges on regional stability, said Ajay Bisaria, Former High Commissioner of India to Pakistan.
summary: India's goal of becoming a $35 trillion economy by 2047 hinges on regional stability, said Ajay Bisaria, Former High Commissioner of India to Pakistan.

title: "Delhi Can Play A Part": Iran President Meets PM Modi Over West Asia Crisis
content: With the conflict in West Asia escalating significantly after Israel and Iran threatened each other of an endless series of retaliations, PM Modi on Tuesday met Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian in Russia on the sidelines of the BRICS Summit.
summary: With the conflict in West Asia escalating significantly after Israel and Iran threatened each other of an endless series of retaliations, PM Modi on Tuesday met Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian in Russia on the sidelines of the BRICS Summit.

title: Yahya Sinwar Death "Important Opportunity" To End Gaza War: Blinken
content: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told Israel's leadership on Tuesday that the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar presented an "important opportunity" to end the war in Gaza.
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told Israel's leadership on Tuesday that the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar presented an "important opportunity" to end the war in Gaza.

title: FBI Investigates Leak Of Classified US Intelligence On Israeli Strike Plans
content: The FBI announced Tuesday it was investigating the alleged leak of classified US intelligence documents about Israel's plans for a retaliatory strike on Iran.
summary: The FBI announced Tuesday it was investigating the alleged leak of classified US intelligence documents about Israel's plans for a retaliatory strike on Iran.

title: India, Pakistan Renew Kartarpur Corridor Agreement For 5 More Years, But...
content: Days after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's visit to Pakistan for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation or SCO meeting, India and Pakistan on Tuesday agreed to renew the agreement on the Kartarpur corridor for another five years.
summary: Days after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's visit to Pakistan for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation or SCO meeting, India and Pakistan on Tuesday agreed to renew the agreement on the Kartarpur corridor for another five years.

title: India Lifts Export Tax On Parboiled Rice As Inventories Surge
content: India on Tuesday scrapped the export tax on parboiled rice, the government said in an official order, as inventories in the world's biggest exporter of the grain surged and the country is set to produce a bumper crop after copious monsoon rains.
summary: India on Tuesday scrapped the export tax on parboiled rice, the government said in an official order, as inventories in the world's biggest exporter of the grain surged and the country is set to produce a bumper crop after copious monsoon rains.

title: Alexei Navalny's Much Awaited Memoir Published Worldwide
content: A much-awaited posthumous memoir by Russian dissident Alexei Navalny was published worldwide on Tuesday, containing sometimes humorous descriptions of his life including his time in prison and the now-famous prediction that he expected to die there.
summary: A much-awaited posthumous memoir by Russian dissident Alexei Navalny was published worldwide on Tuesday, containing sometimes humorous descriptions of his life including his time in prison and the now-famous prediction that he expected to die there.

title: Rock Legend Bruce Springsteen To Join Campaign Rally With Obama And Harris
content: Rock legend Bruce Springsteen will hold a concert and rally with former President Barack Obama in Atlanta and Philadelphia in the coming days as part of a series of get-out-the-vote events for Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign.
summary: Rock legend Bruce Springsteen will hold a concert and rally with former President Barack Obama in Atlanta and Philadelphia in the coming days as part of a series of get-out-the-vote events for Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign.

title: Russian Boxer Banned For Life After Knocking Out Opponent With Head Kick
content: Russian MMA fighter Idris Abdurashidov was banned from boxing for life after delivering an illegal head kick during his professional debut in Phuket, Thailand.
summary: Russian MMA fighter Idris Abdurashidov was banned from boxing for life after delivering an illegal head kick during his professional debut in Phuket, Thailand.
